hotspots.label: Brass Instruments
hotspots.fact: Brass instruments like trumpets and trombones make sound when air vibrates through metal tubes. The longer the tube, the lower the sound produced by the instrument.

hotspots.label: Sound Waves
hotspots.fact: When musicians play instruments together, their sound waves travel through the air and combine. This is called acoustics, and it's why concerts sound better in certain spaces!

hotspots.label: Wind Instruments
hotspots.fact: Wind instruments produce sound when air vibrates inside them. The musician controls the pitch by changing how much air they blow and which holes they cover.

hotspots.label: Marching Band Formation
hotspots.fact: Marching bands arrange musicians in specific patterns to project sound evenly across a field. The positioning helps sound waves reach more people in the audience at once.
